column5: Welcome!
welcome to the loonie bin,and keep your stick on the ice.

Hello every one. My name is Darren and I'm 26 years old. I just moved to Kingston, Ontario from Ottawa. It wasn't an issue in Ottawa to get around to fishing spots with the available cars I could borrow from family. But now it will be a bit harder to hit the waters. I'm actually looking for fishing buddies in the Kingston area. Ive mostly done shore fishing since I don't have access to a boat. I'm off work every weekend so will be hotting the water as much as possible by busing **shudder** and walking. Ive mostly been using my spinning set up but just bought my first baitcaster setup and I'm pumped to try this out. I have a 6'6 MH Abu Garcia Vendetta paired with a Shimano Caene reel. So if any one is interested in a fishing buddy let me know. I just restarted fishing last year when I got my new spinning setup and have gotten hooked again(broke my original rod a long time ago and never got a new one till last year). Getting a new tackle box tomorrow(Friday), YAY.  Anyways, I hope I can help out in this fishing community, take care all.  If there are weird typos or words that make no sense, you can blame my iPhone auto correct =P  PS: I'm more then willing to join any fishing tournament if anyone needs a partner and can provide a ride to the tournaments.
Welcome to the board.

Hey, Welcome to OFC . Sorry I can't help you with the Kingston area but this is a largely populated board with many sincere (except Mercman  ) members who get together all the time. I have met and arranged fishing dates with a number of members on the board. I am in the GTA but there's gotta be some 'good guys' out your way for sure. Maybe think about joining the tournament teams here on OFC and pm/kindly ask the tournament monitor (SlowPoke) if he could place you on a team with a member out your way?? Not sure if that's doable, but worth a try.Here's the tournament team sign up link http://www.ofncommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=50035 Good luck to ya and watch out for Mercman  .  Regards, Slayer
Plenty of good fishing opportunities in the Kingston area, youll find a way to get around!
Hi Darren and welcome to OFC. Since you didn't mention it I will Darren is "Randy from Sturgeons" nephew.
Welcome aboard Darren Better watch what you do around here or I'll tell your mom.   Uncle Randy
Welcome to OFC Darren Looking forward to reading your fishing adventures Leechman
I second that.  Oh and welcome to OFC
Welcome aboard.  I'll be in your neck of the woods this coming September.   Spending a week in Rideau Ferry for some nice bass fishing.
Welcome to the board, sorry you are a little too far away for me to help you out with rides and all but I'm sure you'll do fine if you hang around here for a bit.  Good fishing and tight lines!
Way to go Spliel, he has just lost any and all credibility and good will around here.... Just kidding Darren, you come from good stock
Welcome to the OFC ice shack and good luck in Kingston.
Come on now,you know uncles dont tell.  Welcome.
Not if you buy their beer!  We won't hold Randy against you... welcome aboard!

He is just jealous cuz i out did him at the cottage once. Remembe Randy "Watch, ill catch one in 5 minutes." lol still nothing after 20. I got my rod and got one in 3. Ahhh good times. Cant wait to fish with you for real though.
Welcome to the board !!! Kingston eh   You are surrounded by some of the best fishin spots around !! Kingston Mills, Rideau canal and lakes, 1000 islands !! Cant wait to see some pics.   Paul
Welcome to the board
Welcome to the board

Yeah Kingston mills is the first spot I'm going to try once the ice melts away. I just cant wait for bass season to start. Come on June 25th, come faster! I'm also planing a trip with friends to dog lake 24 minutes away and bay of Quinte. I cant wait to catch'em.
Welcome to our site Darren
Welcome aboard Darren, maybe look into joining a Bass Club, one of the members would offer you rides possibly SBK
Welcome!
Welcome aboard hope ya can find some friends in the area out there
CBAF has a club in Kingston, Avid Bass Anglers (Kingston) / President - Jamie Lemery.  Check out cbaf.ca for info.
Oh sweet. Ill check that out. Thanks.
